page.title: 01Glenconon and Sheader
page.content: Glenconon is a hanging valley, scooped out by a glacier in the ice age. The mountains all round are are except for heather and fir plantations. The rock is basalt. The numerous tributaries of the river conon form spectaculer waterfalls and in the Fairy Glen round Castle Ewen there are said to be 365 hills and hummocks made from glacial moraine. The crofts of about 20 acres slope down both sides of the glen in strrips. Sheep and cattle graze on the fields. The men work as crofters growing hay, corn potatoes and turnipss. they keep cow, shep chickens and collie dogs. the crofters stack their hay in stooks and they make peat stacks for their fuel. there is pony trecking up the glen from Uig hotel.
